      • setDesiredOffset

        public void setDesiredOffset​(int id,
                             Point desiredOffset)
        Sets the desired offset for a label. The offset vector is applied after any configured rotation (the supplied offset vector is considered relative to xyz origin axis that have been rotated by any configured rotation)
        Parameters:
        id - the id of the label.
        desiredOffset - the desired offset as described by a vector (x, y, z)

      • getHints

        public int getHints​(int id)

        Parameters:
        id - the id of the label.
        Returns:
        the currently set hint mask { HINT_* }

      • setFloatWeight

        public void setFloatWeight​(int id,
                           float weight)
        Sets the _float_ weight for a label. This value is a hint to indicate the relative distance along a linestring anchor where a label should be displayed. A value of 0.0f weights at the start of the linestring, a value of 0.5f weights at the center of the linestring and a value of 1.0f weights at the end of the linestring.

        A label will have a default _float_ weight of 0.5f.

        Parameters:
        id - the id of the label.
        weight - the weight

      • addLabel

        public int addLabel()
        Add an empty label to the label manager
        Returns:
        id the id of the label.

      • setFill

        public void setFill​(int id,
                    boolean fill)
        Sets the fill state for a label (filled or unfilled).
        Parameters:
        id - the id of the label.
        fill - true if the label will be filled with the background color or false if just the label text is to be rendered
        See Also:
        setBackgroundColor(int, int)

      • setDesiredOffset

        public void setDesiredOffset​(int id,
                             double x,
                             double y,
                             double z)
        Sets the desired offset for a label. The offsets are applied after any configured rotation (the supplied offsets are considered relative to xyz origin axis that have been rotated by any configured rotation)
        Parameters:
        id - the id of the label.
        x - the desired offset in the x direction
        y - the desired offset in the y direction
        z - the desired offset in the z direction

      • getSize

        public Rectangle getSize​(int id,
                         Rectangle sizeRect)
        Given an existing label id, set the size. Obtained size is only meaningful for visible labels.
        Parameters:
        id - the id of the label.
        sizeRect - the preallocated allocated rectangle that is the size of the text fully rendered
        Returns:
        the size of the text

      • setTextFormat

        public void setTextFormat​(int id,
                          java.lang.String fontName,
                          float size,
                          boolean bold,
                          boolean italic,
                          boolean underline,
                          boolean strikethrough)
        Given an existing label id, set the full text format.
        Parameters:
        id - the id of the label.
        fontName - the name of the font
        size - the size of the font
        bold - the font style will be BOLD if set to true
        italic - the font style will be ITALIC if set to true
        underline - the font style will be UNDERLINE if set to true
        strikethrough - the font style will be STRIKETHROUGH if set to true

        public void setVisible​(int id,

        Given an existing label id, set the visibilty.
        Parameters:
        id - the id of the label.
        visible - true if the label is to be visible

      • setVisible

        public void setVisible​(boolean visible)

      • setLevelOfDetail

        public void setLevelOfDetail​(int id,
                             int minLod,
                             int maxLod)
        Sets _level-of-detail_ thresholds for the specified label. The label will be rendered if the current level-of-detail is greater-than-or-equal to the specified minimum and less than the specified maximum.
        Parameters:
        id - The label ID
        minLod - The minimum level of detail, inclusive
        maxLod - The maximum level of detail, exclusive

      • setHitTestable

        public void setHitTestable​(int id,
                           boolean value)

      • setHeightInMeters

        public void setHeightInMeters​(int id,
                              double heightInMeters)
        Sets the height in meters of the label. This only applies if the HINT_SURFACE hint is set.
        Parameters:
        id - the label ID
        heightInMeters - the height of the label in meters
